debug_option.description: Indicate to TZ that Secure Watchdog Access is enabled.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.
Clear subsystem region when NS_FULL_DUMP is configured.
Indicate to AOP that Secure Watchdog Access is enabled.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.

fuse.name: DISALLOWSOC_DEBUG
fuse.description: Recommendation is to not provide --fuse-disallowsoc-debug. DisallowSOCDEBUG '1' - Disallow unlocking of debug interfaces for the entire SoC (i.e. no SoC debug possible permanently). Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. Not recommended. No RMA /JTAG access possible. '0' - debugging is available.

fuse.name: ENFORCE_OEM_AUTHZ_ON_SOC_DEBUG
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-enforce-oem-authz-on-soc-debug. EnforceOemAuthzOnSoCDebug '1' - Enforce OEM authorization of Debug Policy Requests. When set, OEM must counter-sign Qualcomm debug policies and TME must verify both signatures (Qualcomm and OEM). Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. '0' - Do not enforce OEM counter-signing.

fuse.name: ENFORCE_OEM_AUTHZ_ON_FUSE_OVERRIDES
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-enforce-oem-authz-on-fuse-overrides. EnforceOemAuthzOnFuseOverrides '1' - Fuse overwrite request requires an OEM signature. Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. '0' - Fuse overwrite request does not require an OEM signature.

fuse.name: ENFORCE_OEM_AUTHZ_ON_ROM_PATCH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-enforce-oem-authz-on-rom-patch. EnforceOemAuthzOnROMPatch '1' - Updates to TME/SoC ROM (RoT) requires OEM signature. Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. '0' - Updates to TME/SoC ROM (RoT) do not require OEM signature.

fuse.name: ACTIVATE_SECURITY_POLICY
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-activate-security-policy. ActivateSecurityPolicy Set to '1' for OEMSecurityPolicy bits 0,1,4,5 to take effect.

fuse.name: OEM_DEVICE_LCS
fuse.description: Recommended value is --fuse-oem-device-lcs=0x3. OEM_DEVICE_LCS (OEM Device Life cycle state) 01 => OEM_DEV_LCSID 00,1X => OEM_PROD_LCSID.

fuse.name: OEM_ALL_DEBUG_DISABLE_FUSE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to not provide --fuse-oem-all-debug-disable-fuse. With this bit the OEM indicates that the device cannot be moved into debug state regardless of signed debug commands. All debug is disabled with this bit set.

fuse.name: AUTH_EN
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-auth-en. Blow this bit to enable secure boot for apps and other peripheral images. When this bit is '1'; enables authentication for any code that references secure boot configuration.

fuse.name: PK_HASH_IN_FUSE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-pk-hash-in-fuse. For boot configuration : - If this bit is '0' use the internal ROM hash index and OEM_SECURE_BOOT1_ROM_PK_HASH_IDX[3:0] for the root certificate hash. - If this bit is '1' use the value stored in OEM_PK_HASH for the root certificate hash.

fuse.name: USE_SERIAL_NUM
fuse.description: If this bit is '1', all the images need to be signed with serial number bound, otherwise authentication will fail.

fuse.name: ROM_PK_HASH_IDX
fuse.description: Recommended value is --fuse-rom-pk-hash-idx=0x0. If PK_HASH_IN_FUSE = '0'; this value selects which root certificate hash to use from the ROM table.

fuse.name: OEM_SECURITY_POLICY_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-security-policy-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SECURITY POLICY region. Blow this bit after the OEM SECURITY POLICY region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: WRITE_PERMISSIONS_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-write-permissions-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to WRITE PERMISSIONS region. Blow this bit only if no further changes to Write Permissions are needed.

fuse.name: READ_PERMISSIONS_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-read-permissions-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to READ PERMISSIONS region. Blow this bit after the READ PERMISSIONS region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: FUSE_REDUNDANCY_ENABLE_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-fuse-redundancy-enable-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to FUSE REDUNDANCY ENABLE region. Blow this bit after the FUSE REDUNDANCY ENABLE region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: DEBUG_DISABLE_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-debug-disable-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to DEBUG DISABLE region. Blow this bit after the DEBUG DISABLE region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_CONFIG_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-config-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM CONFIG region. Blow this bit after the OEM CONFIG region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to MRC HASH region. Blow this bit after the MRC HASH region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-product-seed-write-disable. Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM PRODUCT SEED region. Blow this bit after the OEM PRODUCT SEED region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_0_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SPARE 0 region. Blow this bit after the OEM SPARE 0 region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_1_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SPARE 1 region. Blow this bit after the OEM SPARE 1 region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED_READ_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-product-seed-read-disable. Blow this bit after the OEM Product Seed region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH_FEC_ENABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash-fec-enable. Blow to enable FEC for MRC Hash region. Ensure that complete region is provisioned before FEC is enabled.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED_FEC_ENABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-product-seed-fec-enable. Blow to enable FEC for OEM Product Seed region. Ensure that complete region is provisioned before FEC is enabled.

fuse.name: SHRM_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-shrm-dbgen-disable. SHRM Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: CPUCP_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-cpucp-dbgen-disable. CPU Content Protection Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: CPUCP_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-cpucp-niden-disable. CPU Content Protection Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: QSEE_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-qsee-dbgen-disable. QSEE Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: QSEE_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-qsee-niden-disable. QSEE Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: WPSS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-wpss-dbgen-disable. WPSS invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: WPSS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-wpss-niden-disable. WPSS not invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: APPS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-apps-dbgen-disable. Apps Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: APPS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-apps-niden-disable. Apps Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MSS_SCALAR_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mss-scalar-dbgen-disable. MSS Scalar Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MSS_SCALAR_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mss-scalar-niden-disable. MSS Scalar Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: TITAN_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-titan-dbgen-disable. Titan Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: TITAN_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-titan-niden-disable. Titan Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: LPASS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-lpass-dbgen-disable. LPASS Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: LPASS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-lpass-niden-disable. LPASS Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: TURING_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-turing-dbgen-disable. Turing Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: TURING_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-turing-niden-disable. Turing Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: IRIS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-iris-dbgen-disable. IRIS Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: IRIS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-iris-niden-disable. IRIS Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MDSS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mdss-dbgen-disable. MDSS Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MDSS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mdss-niden-disable. MDSS Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DDRSS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-ddrss-dbgen-disable. DDRSS Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DDRSS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-ddrss-niden-disable. DDRSS Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: GPU_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-gpu-dbgen-disable. GPU Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: GPU_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-gpu-niden-disable. GPU Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DAP_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-dap-dbgen-disable. DAP Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DAP_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-dap-niden-disable. DAP Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: APPS_SCANDUMP_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-apps-scandump-disable. Apps Scan Dump disable.

fuse.name: DDRSS_SCANDUMP_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-ddrss-scandump-disable. DDRSS Scan Dump disable.

fuse.name: DEBUGBUS_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-debugbus-disable. Debug bus disable.

fuse.name: DCC_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-dcc-disable. DCC disable.

fuse.name: SMMU_SCANDUMP_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-smmu-scandump-disable. SMMU Scan Dump disable.

fuse.name: E_DLOAD_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Optional. Disables emergency download via removable SD and/or USB downloader in Apps PBL error handler.

fuse.name: ENUM_TIMEOUT
fuse.description: OEM Optional. BOOT ROM must support USB enumeration timeout. Timeout applies to both enumeration for FLCB (fast low current boot) and USB download mode. If USB is not enumerated within time (90 seconds), quit USB enumeration If USB suspend or disconnected after enumeration, start timer again.

fuse.name: FORCE_DLOAD_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM optional. If FORCE_DLOAD_DISABLE is '0'; device goes to download mode if an error occurs very early in XBL1. If FORCE_DLOAD_DISABLE is set to '1'; device goes into cold boot if an error occurs very early in XBL1.

fuse.name: FORCE_USB_BOOT_GPIO_DISABLE
fuse.description: This fuse is used to control booting from FORCE_USB_BOOT_GPIO. It only controls FORCE_USB_GPIO based boot, FDL cookies are not controlled by this fuse. If fuse value = 0 => PBL honors boot from USB if FORCE_USB_BOOT GPIO is flipped. If the GPIO is set to high, PBL will enter USB FEDL path irrespective of FAST_BOOT option selected. If fuse value = 1 => PBL will not enter USB FEDL mode even if FORCE_USB_GPIO is flipped to 1. Boot from FORCE USB GPIO is disabled.

fuse.name: SDCC_ADMA_DISABLE
fuse.description: 0 is default ADMA mode enabled _x000D_ 1 - ADMA mode disabled.

fuse.name: FAST_BOOT
fuse.description: These fuses are used by boot code to specify which device has priority to be booted from. For SM8635, the mapping is as follows: 00000: Default (UFS HS G1 -> USB(SS/HS) on USB 3.0) 00001: USB(SS/HS) 00010: UFS HS G1 -> USB(SS/HS) 00011: Dual IO SPI NOR -> USB (SS/HS) on USB 3.0 00100: QSPI NOR -> USB (SS/HS) on USB 3.0 00101: SPI NOR -> USB (SS/HS) on USB 3.0 Others are reserved.

fuse.name: SPI_CLK_BOOT_FREQ
fuse.description: 00: '85MHz' (Default) 01: '60MHz' 10: '37.5MHz' 11: 'Reserved'.

fuse.name: PBL_FDL_TIMEOUT_RESET_FEATURE_ENABLE
fuse.description: Fuse bit to reset device if PBL enters into EDL mode unintentionally. Enable/disable Force download timeout in case device goes into force USB download accidentally. If enabled, device will reboot after timeout if in force USB download mode. If disabled, phone stays in force USB download. 0 => Disabled 1 => Enabled.

fuse.name: WDOG_EN
fuse.description: Prevents WDOG_DISABLE GPIO from disabling WDOG. Frees up the GPIO and prevents potential for abuse by attacker. This selects whether GPIO_xx can be used to disable the watchdog timer. If enabled, then GPIO_xx, when high, will disable the watchdog. If disabled, then GPIO_xx will not disable the watchdog. The watchdog can still be disabled via software control. 0 => Disabled 1 => Enabled.

fuse.name: PBL_LOG_DISABLE
fuse.description: Used for controlling logging mechanism in PBL. '1' To limit the information collected in PBL logs.

fuse.name: PBL_USB_TYPE_C_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables type-C functionality during PBL. PBL communication/enumeration happens over USB0_SS only. USB1_SS cannot be used.

fuse.name: ROOT_CERT_TOTAL_NUM
fuse.description: Defines the total root cert number supported from the certificate (Upto 4 roots).

fuse.name: QSPI_DMA_DISABLE
fuse.description: 0 => QSPI DMA is enabled 1 => QSPI DMA is disabled.

fuse.name: USB_SS_DISABLE
fuse.description: Used to disable USB SS enumeration during Boot.

fuse.name: USB_PIPO_DISABLE
fuse.description: If fuse value = 0 => USB Plug in – Plug out feature is enabled in PBL. With this feature, if user disconnects and reconnects USB cable on the device we will be able to re-enumerate and go back to EDL with max 3 retries/plugins If fuse value = 1 => USB Plug in – Plug out feature is disabled.

fuse.name: DEBUG_POLICY_DISABLE
fuse.description: Recommendation is to not provide --fuse-debug-policy-disable. Debug Policy is bypassed when this bit is 1. Debug Policy provides a means to re-enable debug capabilities under OEM-specified selectable conditions.

fuse.name: PBL_FDL_TIMEOUT_RESET_TO_VAL
fuse.description: This fuse allows OEMs to have configurable timeout values for FDL timeout reset feature Fuse value | Timeout value (sec) 00 => 5 (default) 01 => 30 10 => 60 11 => 110.

fuse.name: TZ_SW_CRYPTO_FIPS_ENABLE
fuse.description:
Enable/Disable TZ FIPS certifiable mode. Blow this fuse for TZ SW crypto to be FIPS 140-3 certifiable.
Set to '1' to enable TZ FIPS certifiable mode
If OEM needs to evaluate FIPS (for performance, security etc), do not enable this fuse. Set OEM devcfg oem_is_fips_enabled_for_test = 1.
Note: The fuse value and the specific crypto version are required to claim for FIPS validated module. Once this is enabled through fuse, the device will be placed in FIPS mode and cannot be reverted.

fuse.name: EKU_ENFORCEMENT_EN
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-eku-enforcement-en. When this fuse is blown will enable enforcement of the EKU field in the certificate.

fuse.name: OEM_HW_ID
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-hw-id with a user-determined value. The OEM hardware ID. Bits 15:0. This is a unique 16-bit value assigned by Qualcomm to every OEM.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_ID
fuse.description: The OEM product ID. Bits 15:0.

fuse.name: PERIPH_PID
fuse.description: Bits 15:0 of the PID.

fuse.name: PERIPH_VID
fuse.description: Bits 15:0 of the VID.

fuse.name: ANTI_ROLLBACK_FEATURE_EN
fuse.description: Recommended value is --fuse-anti-rollback-feature-en=0xf. Bit 0 - BOOT_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN Bit 1 - TZAPPS_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN Bit 2 - PILSUBSYS_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN Bit 3 - RESERVED FOR FUTURE USE (Blow this bit).

fuse.name: PERIPH_CTRL
fuse.description: Blow this fuse bit to enable Peripheral Control feature.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value. Hash of Multiple Root Certificates (up to 4 certificates) OEMs should blow these fuses for Secure Boot enablement.

fuse.name: FEC_204
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_205
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_206
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_207
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_208
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_209
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_210
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_211
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_212
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-mrc-hash with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_213
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-product-seed with a user-determined value. OEM Product Seed is generated by the OEM and written to SoC fuses. The seed value is used by the OEM to derive device provisioning keys that are specific to the OEM product. It is recommended that this value needs to be kept secret, "OEM PRODUCT SEED Write Disable" and "OEM Product Seed Read Disable" fuses should be blown so that this will only be readable by HW for any key derivation operations.

fuse.name: FEC_214
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-product-seed with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_215
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED
fuse.description: Recommendation is to provide --fuse-oem-product-seed with a user-determined value.

fuse.name: FEC_216
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_0
fuse.description: OEM spare region fuses are not recommended to store any key materials that is non-public in nature.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_1
fuse.description: OEM spare region fuses are not recommended to store any key materials that is non-public in nature.
